heading.emphasis:
Miltochrista lavides Volynkin, Černý & N. Singh
, sp. n.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material .
Holotype
( Figs 28 , 50 ): male, “ Malaysia , Pahang distr. , Cameron Highland , Tanah Rata env.,
1450– 1500 m
, 4°28’25.3’’N , 101°22’43.7’E,
15.III.2011
–
31.III.2011
, leg. Karol Bucsek ” / red label “ Holotype
Miltochrista lavides Volynkin, Černý & N. Singh
”, slide ZSM Arct. 2019-602 Volynkin (Coll. MWM/ZSM).

( 138 males , 257 females ).

Remark. The species was erroneously reported for Malay Peninsula as ‘
Lyclene lutara Moore, 1859
’ by Bucsek (2012) .
Miltochrista lutara
(illustrated by Volynkin (2017)) is distributed in Sumatra and Java Islands and has very different genitalia structures.

Diagnosis . Forewing length is 7.5–10 mm (wingspan 18–20.5 mm ) in males and 10–11 mm (wingspan 20.5– 21.5 mm ) in females. The new species is similar externally to
M. adelfika
sp. n.
, but the male differs by its more elongate discal spot of forewing situated more distally. The female of
M. lavides
sp. n.
differs from that of
M. adelfika
sp. n.
by its less elongate forewing with more arcuate anal margin, the discal spot situated more distally and the narrower subterminal area. In the male genital capsule, the valva structure is most similar to that of
M. kosterini
, but the costa is much more curved and broadened subapically, its tip is narrow, pointed and directed dorsally (whereas in
M. kosterini
that is broader, apically rounded and directed distally), the sacculus is broader, its distal process is rounded apically (in
M. kosterini
that is apically pointed), and the distal membranous lobe of valva is absent. Compared to that of
M. kosterini
, aedeagus of
M. lavides
sp. n.
is more tapered, the aedeagus vesica of the new species is narrower, bears a bunch of three robust spine-like cornuti (whereas in
M. kosterini
there are four larger arrowhead-like cornuti), its subbasal ventral diverticulum is narrower but more elongated, its medial diverticulum is much narrower and more weakly granulated, and the vesica ejaculatorius is narrower. The female genitalia of
M. lavides
sp. n.
differ from those of
M. kosterini
by their much smaller accessory bursae bearing a broader cluster of spinules at cervix bursae, much narrower posterior section of corpus bursae, and much smaller anterior section of corpus bursae bearing smaller spinules.
Etymology . In Greek, the word ‘λαβίδες’ means ‘tongs’. The specific epithet refers to the new species’ valvae shape, which makes the genital capsule similar to cooking tongs.
